(6)  13-12-436-009. 
(b)  Penalties. Any person violating the provisions of this section shall be subject to a fine of $750.00 for each violation. 
(c)  Definitions. The following words, terms and phrases, when used in this section, shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this subsection, except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning: 
    Person means any individual, city, partnership, co-partnership, firm, company, limited liability company, corporation, association, joint stock company; trust, estate, political subdivision, or any other legal entity, or their legal representatives, agents or assigns; company; trust, estate, political subdivision, or any other legal entity, or their legal representatives, agents or assigns. 
    Potable water means any water used for human or domestic consumption, including, but not limited to, water used for drinking, bathing, swimming, washing dishes, or preparing foods. 
(Code 2008, § 13.08.350) 
Secs. 74-329-74-359. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE IV. - BILLING 

Sec. 74-360. - Schedule. 
    All water and sewer customers will be billed for usage on a monthly basis. 
(Code 2008, § 13.10.010; Ord. No. 10-85, § 1, 1985) 
Sec. 74-361. - Date sent out. 
    Water and sewer bills will be sent out by the city on the first working day of the month succeeding the period for which the usage is billed. 
(Code 2008, § 13.10.020; Ord. No. 10-85, § 2, 1985) 
Sec. 74-362. - Payment due date; late penalty. 
    All water and sewer bills are due and payable on or before the last day of the month in which the bills were sent out. A $5.00 penalty shall be added to all bills not paid by this date. 
(Code 2008, § 13.10.030; Ord. No. 10-85, § 3, 1985) 
Sec. 74-363. - Delinquent bills; service discontinuance. 
    Current billing not paid by the last day of the month will be billed with a $5.00 penalty and a shutoff notice on the first of the following month. All delinquent accounts not paid by the 15th of that month will be shut off on the 16th. Once an account is shut off for nonpayment it will not be turned back on until the account is paid in full and a $25.00 turn-on fee has been paid. Water that has been shut off for nonpayment will only be turned back on between the hours of 8:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m., Monday through Friday, excluding holidays observed by the city. 
(Code 2008, § 13.10.040; Ord. No. 2-93, § 5, 1993; Ord. No. 10-85, § 4, 1985) 
Sec. 74-364. - Turn-on fee. 
    A turn-on fee shall be charged to reinstate water service only after that service has been discontinued for nonpayment. The turn-on fee shall be $25.00 if the service is reinstated during regular working hours of the city. The turn-on fee shall be $50.00 if the service is to be reinstated on a Saturday, Sunday, city-observed holiday or between the hours of 3:30 p.m. and 7:00 a.m. 
(Code 2008, § 13.10.050; Ord. No. 10-85, § 5, 1985) 
Secs. 74-365-74-386. - Reserved. 
ARTICLE V. - RATES 
DIVISION 1. - GENERALLY 

Sec. 74-387. - Rate fee structure, permit and inspection fees. 
(a)  Water permit fees shall be $225.00. 
(b)  Sewer permit fees shall be $400.00. 
(c)  Water tap fees. 
(1)  Tapping fees for the city to make water taps on water mains shall be as follows: 
a.  Three-quarter-inch: Market price plus 20 percent. 
b.  One-inch: Market price plus 20 percent. 
c.  11/2-inch to two-inch: Market price plus 20 percent. 
(2)  It is the responsibility of the builder-developer to undertake two inches plus size taps. A ten percent inventory/handling fee shall be added to all materials provided by the city. 
(Code 2008, § 17.1440(C)-(E); Ord. No. 09-06, § I, 5-4-2009; Ord. No. 09-08, § I, 11-16-2009; Ord. No. 11-02, § I, 2-21-2011; Ord. No. 12-12, § I, 7-2-2012; Ord. No. 12-21, § I, 11-5-2012; Ord. No. 15-01, § I, 1-5-2015) 
Secs. 74-388-74-417. - Reserved. 
DIVISION 2. - WASTEWATER SERVICE CHARGES 

Sec. 74-418. - Basis for wastewater service charges. 
    The basic user charge shall be based on water usage as recorded by water meters and/or sewage meters for wastes having the following normal domestic concentrations: 
(1)  A five-day, 20-degree Centigrade biochemical oxygen demand (BOD of 226 mg/l). 
(2)  A suspended solids (SS) content of 275 mg/l. 
(3)  Compute costs per 1,000 gallons for normal sewage strength. Compute surcharge costs per pound per 1,000 gallons. 
a.  A surcharge will be levied to all users whose waters exceed the normal domestic concentrations of BOD (225 mg/l) and SS (275 mg/1). The surcharge will be based on water usage as recorded by water meters and/or sewage meters for all wastes which exceed the 225 mg/l and 275 mg/l concentration for BOD and SS respectively. Section 74-424 specifies the procedure to compute a surcharge. 
b.  The adequacy of the wastewater service charge shall be reviewed, not less often than annually, by certified public accountants for the city in their annual audit report. The wastewater service charge shall be revised periodically to reflect a change in local capital costs or a change in operation and maintenance costs including replacement costs. 
c.  The users of wastewater treatment services will be notified annually, in conjunction with a regular bill, of the rate and that portion of the user charges which are attributable to the wastewater treatment operation, maintenance and replacement. 
(Code 2008, § 13.11.005; Ord. No. 11-83(part), 1983) 
Sec. 74-419. - Measurement of flow. 
    The volume of flow used for computing basic user charges and surcharges shall be the metered water consumption read to the lowest even increments of 100 gallons. 
(1)  If the person discharging wastes into the public sewers procures any part, or all, of his water from sources other than the public waterworks system, all or a part of which is discharged into the public sewers, the person shall install and maintain, at his expense, water meters of a type approved by the city for the purpose of determining the volume of water obtained from these other sources. 
(2)  Devices for measuring the volume of waste discharged may be required by the city if these volumes cannot otherwise be determined for the metered water consumption records. 
(3)  Metering devices for determining the volume of waste shall be installed, owned and maintained by the person. Following approval and installation, such meters may not be removed, unless service is cancelled, without the consent of the city. 
(Code 2008, § 13.11.010; Ord. No. 11-83(part), 1983) 
Sec. 74-420. - Local capital cost charge. 
(a)  Debt service charge. A debt service charged may be determined by the city council in an amount per 1,000 gallons, to be charged each user of wastewater facility of the city. This is in addition to the basic user rate established by ordinance. 
(b)  Capital improvement charge. A capital improvement charge may be determined and levied on all users by the city council in an amount per 1,000 gallons, to provide funds for extensions, improvement or reconstruction of the sewage treatment works. This amount is in addition to the basic user rate established by ordinance. 
(c)  Basic water user rate. 
(1)  There shall be a rate as determined by the city council for a debt service to be billed monthly at a rate per 1,000 gallons with a minimum monthly billing for 2,000 gallons. 
(2)  The rate for debt service as determined by the city council shall be billed double for those accounts outside the city limits. 
(Code 2008, § 13.11.015; Ord. No. 11-83(part), 1983) 
Sec. 74-421. - Basic user rate. 
    Rates for sewer supplied shall be effective and billed May 1 and shall be by the city presently in effect are: 
(1)  $4.12 per 1,000 gallons of usage within the corporate limits of the city each month. 
(2)  $6.18 per 1,000 gallons of usage outside the corporate limits of the city each month. 
(3)  On May 1, 2017; May 1, 2018; and May 1, 2019, the billing clerk shall adjust the monthly rate by adding an amount equal to ten percent of the respective rate in effect on the date of each adjustment. On May 1, 2020, and May 1, 2021, the billing clerk shall adjust the monthly rate by adding an amount equal to five percent of the respective rate in effect on the date of each adjustment. The city may, in its discretion, waive or reduce any such adjustment. On May 1, 2022, and on each May 1 thereafter, the rate for use of the city's water system may be adjusted by ordinance to reflect any changes necessary to pay the cost of operation and maintenance of the sewer system, provide an adequate depreciation fund, and pay the principal and interest upon all revenue bonds issued under the Illinois Municipal Code. 
(4)  The utility rate for a meter installed to register the use of water not discharged into the sanitary sewer shall be billed at the current rate charged for water only. The water consumption billed at the sewer rate for a monthly utility billing will not be applied. All of the following conditions must be met to qualify for the billing to reflect a water only charge. 
a.  A separate water meter must be installed to measure the water used and not discharged into the sanitary sewer system. 
b.  The meter must be installed prior to the existing home meter on a separate water line with a shut-off valve prior to the meter installed. 
c.  The meter must be connected to an outdoor faucet, whereby access for its use is only accessible from the outside of the residence. Faucets or any other apparatus for connecting to this water service in a garage or outbuilding is prohibited. 
d.  The homeowner will be billed monthly for gallons used with a minimum billing for 2,000 gallons of water or less. 
e.  The only exception to the minimum monthly billing is notification to the City of Eureka water billing department that the meter has been turned off and there is zero usage. Owners will be allowed only one turn-on and one shut-off each year. 
f.  The meter reflecting any usage will be billed a minimum for that month. 
g.  Failure to notify the city the meter has been turned on and usage appears full billing for water and sewer will be applied. 
h.  The homeowner shall be responsible for the full cost of the meter and installation. 
i.  The homeowner shall notify the city upon completion of the installation of the meter and the required connections. All piping must be exposed for the inspection to take place. 
j.  Failure of the homeowner to call for the inspection will void the billing exemption from the sewer rate charge. 
(Code 2008, § 13.11.020; Ord. No. 12-14, § 1, 7-16-2012; Ord. No. 17-04, § 3, 4-3-2017) 
Sec. 74-422. - Minimum charge. 
(a)  The minimum usage charged per month for both water and sewer, shall be for 2,000 gallons. 
(b)  Utility customers considered "vacation accounts" will be billed and charged a minimum usage of 1,000 gallons per month for both water and sewer until reclassified active and then water and sewer basic user rate will apply. 
(Code 2008, § 13.11.025; Ord. No. 11-83(part), 1983; Ord. No. 04-13, 12-6-2004) 
Sec. 74-423. - Charges outside city limits. 
    All users outside the city limits shall pay double the charges listed in sections 74-420 through 74-422. 
(Code 2008, § 13.11.030; Ord. No. 11-83(part), 1983) 
Sec. 74-424. - Surcharge rate. 
(a)  The rates of surcharges for BOD 5 and SS shall be as follows: 
(1)  Per pound of BOD: $0.1488. 
(2)  Per pound of SS: $0.1222. 
(b)  The city council reserves the right to change and adjust the rate as needed to process and disposal of waste. 
(Code 2008, § 13.11.035) 
Sec. 74-425. - Computation of surcharge. 
    The concentration of wastes used for computing surcharges shall be established by waste sampling. Waste sampling shall be performed as often as may be deemed necessary by the city and shall be binding as a basis for surcharges. 
(Code 2008, § 13.11.040; Ord. No. 11-83(part), 1983) 
Sec. 74-426. - Computation of wastewater service charge. 
    The wastewater service charge shall be computed by the following formula and the establishment of each charge that can be imposed on the sewer rate. The rates for each of the following shall be established and determined by the city council. The city reserves the right to establish a rate for each and the rate shall be calculated follows: 
CW = CD + CC + CU x VU + CS 
Where per: 
CW = Amount of waste service charge dollar amount billing period 
CD = Debt service charges 
CC = Capital improvement charge 
Vu = Wastewater volume for the billing period, minimum 2,000 gallons 
(Code 2008, § 13.11.045) 
Sec. 74-427. - Payment of bills. 
(a)  The rates or charges for service shall be payable monthly for which bills are rendered. The owner of the premises, the occupant thereof and the user of the service shall be jointly and severally liable to pay for the service to such premises and the service is furnished to the premises by the city only upon the condition that the owner of the premises, occupant and user of the services are jointly and severally liable therefor to the city. 
(b)  Bills for sewer service shall be sent out by the city on the first day of the month succeeding the period for which the service is billed. 
(c)  All sewer bills are due and payable within 30 days of billing. A penalty of $5.00 shall be added to all bills not paid within the 30-day grace period. 
(Code 2008, § 13.11.050; Ord. No.11-83(part), 1983) 
Sec. 74-428. - Unpaid bills to become a lien; notice. 
(a)  Whenever a bill for sewer service remains unpaid for 60 days after it has been rendered, the city shall file with the county recorder of deeds a statement of lien claim. This statement shall contain the legal description of the premises served, the amount of the unpaid bill, and a notice that the city claims a lien for this amount as well as for all charges subsequent to the period covered by the bill. 
(b)  If the user whose bill is unpaid is not the owner of the premises and the city has notice of this; notices shall be mailed to the owner of the premises if his address is known to the city, whenever such bill remains unpaid for the period of 45 days after it has been rendered. 
(c)  The failure of the city to record such lien or to mail such notice or the failure of the owner to receive such notice shall not affect the right to foreclose the lien for unpaid bills as mentioned in the foregoing section. 
(Code 2008, § 13.11.060; Ord. No. 11-83(part), 1983) 
Sec. 74-429. - Foreclosure of lien. 
    Property subject to a lien for unpaid charges may be sold for nonpayment of the same, and the proceeds of the sale shall be applied to pay the charges, after deducting costs, as is the case in the foreclosure of statutory liens. Such foreclosure shall be by bill in equity in the name of the city. The city attorney is authorized and directed to institute such proceedings in the name of the city in any court having jurisdiction over such matters against any property for which the bill has remained unpaid 60 days after it has been rendered. 
(Code 2008, § 13.11.065; Ord. No. 11-83(part), 1983) 
Sec. 74-430. - Accounts; recordkeeping; audits. 
(a)  The city treasurer shall establish a proper system of accounts and shall keep proper books, records, and accounts in which complete and correct entries shall be made of all transactions relative to the sewerage system. 
(b)  In addition to the customary operating statements, the annual audit report shall also reflect the revenues and operating expenses of the wastewater facilities, including a replacement cost, to indicate that sewer service charges under the waste cost recovery system and capital amounts required to be recovered under the industrial cost recovery system do in fact meet these regulations. In this regard, the financial information to be shown in the audit report shall include the following: 
(1)  Flow data showing total gallons received at the wastewater plant for the current fiscal year; 
(2)  Billing data to show total number of gallons billed per fiscal year; 
(3)  Debt service for the next succeeding fiscal year; 
(4)  Number of users connected to the system; 
(5)  Number of non-metered users; 
(6)  A list of users discharging non-domestic and industrial wastes and volume of waste discharged. 
(Code 2008, § 13.11.075; Ord. No. 11-83(part), 1983) 
Sec. 74-431. - Notice of rates. 
    Each user will be notified by the city in conjunction with a regular bill, of the rate and that portion of the user charges or ad valorem taxes which are attributable to wastewater treatment services. 
(Code 2008, § 13.11.080; Ord. No. 11-83(part), 1983) 
Sec. 74-432. - Effective date of rates. 
    The rates and service charges established for user charges in sections 74-420 through 74-426 shall be effective as of the next fiscal year beginning May 1 of each year and bill to be rendered the month being May 1 of each year. 
(Code 2008, § 13.11.090; Ord. No. 11-83(part), 1983) 
Secs. 74-433-74-462. - Reserved.
